fields.description:
I am using confluence 5.2 and using the tasklist. 
When I create a new task I assign a resource to it. I'm saving the changes and leave the page. 
When I return to the page I see that all the new tasks I've cretaed are assigned to me, and not to the resource I assigned. 
For example:
Task1: Clean the toielt
assign: Resource#1 (Me)
Task2: Clean the room
assign: Resource#2 (John)

-> Refresh page->

Task1: Clean the toilet
assign: Resource#1 (Me)
Task2: Clean the room
assign: Resource#1 (Me)

Why is that happening? 
How do I assign resources different then me to different tasks??
Please help me.

Thanks a lot :)
fields.summary: Trouble assigning a resource to a Task list

fields.description:
This supersedes CONF-27023, whereby the fallback mechanism of editor loading is broken.

Although we are fixing the worst part of that issue in 5.5.1, there will still be Confluence instances where the editor loads very slowly.

This can happen for a variety of reasons but the most common one is when the editor resource batching falls apart due to a plugin.  This is technical and complex.

The editor quick-loading works by fetching the additional javascript and css resources required to show the editor, after the page has loaded.  These are fetched as a couple of batches (eg batch.js and batch.css), so there aren't very many individual js and css files downloaded to show the editor.  The batches are cacheable, improving things further.

However, if some of the resources in the editor batch were already required to view the page, then the batch provider takes drastic action.  It doesn't want to give out a batch that contains a resource that's already been loaded, because then it would be loaded twice, which could break things.  So, it unbatches the batch and provides the resources individually.

Therefore, the dynamic editor loading has to download dozens of resources instead of 4-6, which takes much longer.

This is usually because a plugin, either Atlassian or 3rd party, is misbehaving in a very subtle way.

h3. How to determine why the comment editor loading is slow:

*These steps are currently slightly unverified but should work* - if you run into any issues let us know in the comments below.

# Navigate to a page where the comment editor is known to load slowly
# Open the javascript console of your browser.
# Execute 
{code}AJS.$(AJS.$('meta[name="ajs-editor.loader.resources"]').attr('content')).filter('script').size()
AJS.$(AJS.$('meta[name="ajs-editor.loader.resources"]').attr('content')).filter('link').size(){code}
# If these do not return small numbers, less than about 6, then your resources are unbatched (this is bad).
# Turn up logging on the server for com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.assembler.DefaultWebResourceAssembler to DEBUG
# Visit a page and do a hard refresh
# Find the line in the server logs that looks like this
bq. "The module '<some module>' has already been included in the Assembler. Inclusion contexts = <some contexts>, required contexts = <some more contexts>"
# Determine which plugin is requiring the <some module>.  If you're lucky it's obvious.  If you're unlucky, you might need to turn off a lot of plugins to stop it happening.  If this happens on specific pages, try removing the macros used on those pages to see if the logging stops.
If you don't see this logging, then your older version of Confluence probably doesn't have that logging.  Talk to support to confirm that, they might just need to find a different class to increase logging for, and upgrade to a newer version.
# Report the problem to the plugin developer. If this is Atlassian, let us know in a comment below.  They may need to use separate resources for the editor and view page. Or they may just need to use resource contexts instead of using resources directly.
fields.summary: Quick comment editor loads very slowly and falls back

h4.Steps to Reproduce:
# Add bamboo chart as an external gadget

Page preview shows *two* Bamboo Charts in Page Preview and *one* after save the page.

With refreshing from *cog button* extra chart removed from Page Preview.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33332].
  {panel}

The Shared Links Blueprint allows teams to share links and discuss them in Confluence.

We've heard a bit of feedback to suggest that sharing links happens more from Mobile. On the commute to work or travelling, people read news, RSS feeds etc.. on their mobile and often want to share and discuss it with their team.

Some suggestions we've had here:
* Share links via email
This would create a Shared Link BP with discussion in Confluence
* A native mobile app which integrates with popular news reader apps for sharing 
....
fields.summary: Provide an easier way to share links through mobile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33329].
  {panel}

Due to  how Confluence is build, schema updates can happen any time when the instance is up and running especially for plugins, including third party plugins operation.

This made specific database configuration where Confluence can only use regular account that unable to updates database schema not possible.

In order to workaround this, Confluence should provide a feature that could delay all schema updates and trigger at the same time when the administrator prefer.

In regards to plugin installation process, Confluence could mark this plugin as inactive until all the necessary process to complete its installation are triggered at the same time as the other schema updates process.

*Possible Implementation*

A new queue menu under JIRA administrators could be implemented for this feature. Like Mail Queue menu, administrators have the privilege to see the pending task that need to be run and administrator can choose which task to run individually or the whole queue at the same time
fields.summary: Delay All Schema Updates and Trigger it at The Same Time
Need a way to reference old version of office documents

fields.description:
Some macros will have a different Icon/Image when the title containing Left Curly Brace ('{') at the beginning, middle, or end.

h6. Steps to Replicate
# Create a new page
# Insert Expand Macro
# In the Macro dialog box, set the title to be '{test'
# Save the Macro

h6. Observed Result
The macro loses its default icon if the left curly brace is placed at the beginning or middle of the title. When it's placed at the end of the title, the macro loses all content in header (icon and title)

h6. Expected Result
The left curly brace in the title shouldn't affect the interface of the macro in Editor

h6. Affected Macro
- Expand Macro
- Information Macro
fields.summary: Incorrect Macro Icon when Macro Title Contains Left Curly Brace '{'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33297].
  {panel}

if you are trying to write a template for use with the AutoExport plugin, and you need access to the exported URL of an arbitrary AbstractPage (ie: the current page, or any of it's children) for any reason (in my current situation: to pass as a query param in an ifram for an external service) there is no way to do this (from the template):
$page.urlPath (java: AbstractPage.getUrlPath()) is the pre-exported path in confluence
$autoexport.link($page) (java: ExportUtils.link(AbstractPage)) generates an <a href=""/> for the page, still using the pre-exported path
ExportBeautifier will look for html nodes with "href" and "src" attributes and convert the paths, but it won't look for paths in arbitrary text (ie: script bodies, escaped in iframe params, etc...)
It would be helpful if some object was made available in the VelocityContext that had a simple method for retrieving the final exported (relative) url of an arbitrary AbstractPage as a String, which could then be included in the response as is (or if necessary for passing as an argument in some other url, escaped using $generalUtil.urlEncode())
fields.summary: Autoexport - method for accessing (relative) url for exported page(s) from template

fields.description:
When exporting pages with titles like *A.1.1* and *A.11*, they will have the same filename *a11.html*, that cause collision, for two different pages we'll have only one exported file. Also such collisions may appear when using non-english titles for pages.

Attached patch very reduces the possibility of such collisions mentioned in this issue.
fields.summary: Autoexport - Exporting filenames conflicts fix

* $page.urlPath (java: AbstractPage.getUrlPath()) is the pre-exported path in confluence
* $autoexport.link($page) (java: ExportUtils.link(AbstractPage)) generates an <a href=""/> for the page, still using the pre-exported path
* ExportBeautifier will look for html nodes with "href" and "src" attributes and convert the paths, but it won't look for paths in arbitrary text (ie: script bodies, escaped in iframe params, etc...)

It would be helpful if some object was made available in the VelocityContext that had a simple method for retrieving the final exported (relative) url of an arbitrary AbstractPage as a String, which could then be included in the response as is (or if necessary for passing as an argument in some other url, escaped using $generalUtil.urlEncode())
fields.summary: Autoexport plugin - Method for accessing (relative) url for exported page(s) from template

fields.description:
In the Apache Sling project we use the RecentlyChanged macro to display the latest changes on the front page. The AutoExport plugin works fine on most pages, but does not refresh pages where the RecentlyChanged macro is present. As such, the index page remains stale. Compare [source page|https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/SLING/Index] with the [exported page|https://cwiki.apache.org/SLING/index.html].

The AutoExport plugin should always refresh pages which use the RecentlyChanged macro when a page is changed.
fields.summary: AutoExport does not work with the RecentlyChanged macro

h3. Symptoms
In version 5.5.1 of the plugin 'JIRA Macros ", the control buttons are not available, the only remaining option return to version 5.4.5. 
Attached the screens.

h3.Workarounds
* In order to workaround this issue, please hit *Enter* to submit the macro and "Esc" to cancel.
* Alternatively you can remove the affected version of JIRA Macros:
*# Go to Admin > Manage Add-ons and uninstall JIRA Macros
*# Then download version 5.4.5 from [the Marketplace here|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.jira/versions]
*# Upload that through Manage Add-ons > Upload add-on.

h3. Resolution
Upgrade JIRA Issues Macro to version 5.5.2.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33281].
  {panel}

Having an attachments macro with a label filter leads to a confusing behavior for end users:

* They D&D files to the macro view and the file are not shown, because non of them have the required label attached
* They may repeat this multiple times (generating multiple versions) and finally give up

A better behavior would be to let the macro with the label filter apply the respective label(s) when files are attached through their upload area.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33279].
  {panel}

I have created a draft page for proposals, with a child page for each chapter, sub-chapter, etc. so my colleagues and I can collaboratively create proposals.
Every page has a prefix "Prop - " to show that this is the proposal master.
On parent pages, I included the child pages one by one so a chapter can also be read all in one on the parent page.

For each new proposal, the whole master-page with all child pages shall be copied with "Copy Page Tree" and the "Prop - " prefix is replaced during the process.

My issue now is: The page include macro doesn't change during the copy process and still points to the master draft and I would need to change all (about 100 for each proposal) to the new pages.

Can the page include be improved by a functionality "include all child pages on the next page level", which allows to include all direct child pages on the parent page?
eg.: the page "1.parent" shall include "1.1.child 1" and "1.2.child 2" but not "1.1.1.sub-child 1".
fields.summary: Include-page should include all child pages on one page-level below

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33271]. {panel} We believe people have gotten into this state by copying content from web pages and pasting it into the editor. The steps below to reproduce require manual database intervention solely because it's simpler than finding malformed HTML to copy. The two examples we have so far are with empty tags and empty
tags. h3. Empty Div Tags To reproduce: # Create a page and save it. # Find the page in BODYCONTENT in the database # Run this to add an empty div tag: {code} update bodycontent set body = '
' where bodycontentid = the-id; {code} # Restart Confluence. # Try to add a comment, and you will see the comment box has a smaller grey box inside, and you cannot type into it. !empty div tag.png! h4. Workarounds * Install the [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor], and use it to find and remove the empty tag * View the source of the page in your browser and searching for the empty tag, then remove it in Edit mode. h3. Empty Img Tags To reproduce: # Create a page and save it. # Find the page in BODYCONTENT in the database # Run this to add an empty img tag: {code} update bodycontent set body = '' where bodycontentid = the-id; {code} # Restart Confluence. # Edit the page and try to add a macro by typing a leading '{'. The macro list does not appear. !empty img tag.png! h4. Workarounds * Go to Insert and Other Macros, then select a macro from there. * Install the [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor], and use it to find and remove the empty tag * View the source of the page in your browser and searching for the empty tag, then remove it in Edit mode. * Add some text underneath where the empty tag is and then go to a new line. The macro browser will then appear and you can enter macros.
fields.summary: Malformed XHTML can exist in page storage format and causes various issues with editing and commenting

Changes made to labels are not registering int he system. I made several label changes, and after I made the changes, and click to view all pages with the new label, it states that there are no pages at this time, although the label is clearly shown on the page. I also deleted the labels from several pages, but these still show up when I click the first label in the tag cloud.

I appears that something in the system has not registered that the labels were changed/deleted.

To replicate:
1. Create page and add any label to it.
2. Click on the label -- no pages will show up for this label.
3. Delete any label from already existing page.
4. Then click on the label from another page. The page from which you deleted the label will still appear.

fields.description:
I have a problem with importing Microsoft Word documents when using Ad Hoc Workflows plugin. 

Steps to reproduce: 
Install Ad hoc Workflows plugin v. 4.3.6 and apply license for it 
Apply workflow for the project (Select project/Space tools/workflows/Simple approval workflow/Press button with hint Make this workflow active for all pages in this space and select "copy" option) 
Upload the document for the first time (Tools/Import Word Document) 
* Choose the document (download Confluence Import 2.docx from attachments) 
* Choose options: 
* Confluence Import - leave default value 
* Where to import - Import as a new page in the current space 
* Title conflicts - Replace existing pages with imported pages of the same title 
* Split by heading - Level 5 Headings 

Upload the document again with the same parameters 

There are some problems: 
1. Stacktrace is shown for user (You can see it in stacktrace.txt from attachments) 
2. PageUpdateEvents with null originalPages are generated (You can see it in stacktrace2.txt from attachments)
fields.summary: Import Word Document functionality is not working with Ad hoc plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33249].
  {panel}

Customers often will use their Confluence as a public facing, anonymously accessible documentation source.

In these sorts of situations, Confluence can be subjected to higher than normal traffic loads. We've seen some cases in support where customer facing instances were having increased load being generated by the Quick Reload plugin - the plugin that's responsible for letting a user know when a new comment has been added to the page.

At the moment, we have two [potential workarounds|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=588581674] for dealing with this issue, however, some customers may want the functionality that Confluence provides for logged in users, while disabling it for anonymous users.

I'd like to suggest an improvement, either:

# Being able to disable this endpoint for anonymous users if required
# Being able to increase the time out between checks to the endpoint.

Either of these improvements would be a small but helpful change for customers who have their Confluence instance accessible to the public.
fields.summary: The quick reload plugin can generate too much load

The Children Display Macro is not able to render the Excerpt Macro derived from embedded Excerpt Include Macro. Instead of displaying the excerpts from the original page, the page name from which the excerpt include macro is associated to is displayed.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create *Page A*, insert excerpt macro (with some text)
# Create *Page B*, insert excerpt macro (with include excerpt macro associated to Page A)
!excerptInclude.png!
# Create *Page C*, insert Children Display Macro (tick include excerpt)

**Having more than one include excerpt macro in Page B's excerpt without new line (pressing enter) would display a concatenated result, if the macros are in two lines, only the first result is displayed and the second one is ignored.
fields.summary: Children Display Macro displays excerpts incorrectly
System information can be confirmed to customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33244].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
Some usernames aren't autocompleted when mentioning or assigning a task to a user.

*Cause:*
When adding Confluence to a JIRA Cloud instance, users are not properly migrated over.
This also causes [Duplicates in the People Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Duplicates+in+the+People+Directory] (covered by this bug [CONF-9857|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9857])

*Steps to reproduce:*
# create a JIRA only instance
# add users
# add Confluence to the instance
# grant access to the users
# try to mention a user that was created previously (before they access Confluence for the first time) accessing just JIRA won't update the 'content' table.
Created users won't be displayed in the People directory although they are Confluence users with access.
Once the user logs in to Confluence, the user is mentionable.

*Expected:* users are mentionable because they have Confluence access
*Actual:* users are not mentionable

*Temporary Workarounds:*
* Manually run a Content Reindex 
(due to [CONF-33400 - Confluence Administrators unable to Reindex Manually|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33400] please contact support at http://support.atlassian.com to run the Content Reindex)
* Login the user to Confluence
* Visit their Profile page manually by changing the username on another Profile page.
fields.summary: User autocomplete not finding all users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you drag and drop an existing image using IE, Confluence will upload a new copy of that image to the page (with a different name)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using IE, Open a page in Confluence that you have edit rights on
# Drag and Drop an existing image in that page
# Open the attachments tab


h3. Environment
IE 10 and 11


h3. Expected Results
All attachments should still be the same


h3. Actual Result
A new attachment is added to the list with a different name
Ironically, this attachment file size is larger than the original one


h3. Workaround
This behaviour is only seen in IE 10 and 11.
As a workaround use other browsers such as Chrome and Firefox
fields.summary: Dragging image slightly on page in Internet Explorer reattaches image

fields.description:
If you click in the "Running task" hyperlink while executing any kind of exporting action (like PDF for instance):
!img1.png|thumbnail!
Your action will be cancelled and you will get the following error:
!img2.png|thumbnail!

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Go to a Space in Confluence.
# Click in Space Tool > Content Tools
# Export Tab.
# Choose PDF
(i) Happens with the others as well.
# Once you get into the long task running page click in the "Running task hyperlink.
# Your Action will be cancelled and you will get the following error:
{code} 
Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.
{code}

h4. Workaround:
*Do not* click in the "Running task" hyper link, export will work in the way it should.
fields.summary: Clicking in the "Running task" HyperLink cancels the action with an error.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33241]. {panel} Now it is impossible to add multilevel numbering to the page headings in multipage PDF export. It is because of enclosing page's heading elements (that may be demoted to h1,h2,h3,...h7 during page hierarchy building when exporting) into the div.wiki-content > div.pagetitle. That's why calling smth. like h1 { counter-reset: h1-title; } has no meaning because it will create a new instance of h1-title counter in the parent element div.wiki-content > div.pagetitle and will be popd after it is closed. And when a new div.wiki-content element (a new page) will be opened there will be a untouched counter value. Please add a class to the div.wiki-content element that can classify the heading level (h1,h2,..h7) of the page title of the enclosed content (actually it will be enaught to copy the name of the type of the first child of the div.wiki-content > div.pagetitle element). Something like this:

Main topic

....

Subpage title

You can check the difference in this JS Fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/9pJdS/4/ (see the css to point the feature use)
fields.summary: Please add a class specifying the resulting heading level of the title of the page to the div.wiki-content element

fields.description:
Setting this to Critical as it inflates license counts and therefor negatively affects your customer costs.

h6. Reproduce:

1. Create an LDAP Directory with Basic Setttings and Ensure its Working
2. Add any negative logic to your Object Filter

h6. Example:
Change:
{code}
(&(objectCategory=Person)(sAMAccountName=*)) 
{code}
to
{code}
(&(objectCategory=Person)(sAMAccountName=*)(!OU=serviceaccounts,dc=yourdomain,dc=com))
{code}
Additionally the "Test Settings" button only tests the connection, it verifies NOTHING else.  Change the button text or actually test the full LDAP settings please.

You will see this in the log on any attempted login.  No LDAP users will be able to login.

fields.description:
h3. Step to Reproduce
# Create a new template by going to:
#* Confluence Admin >> Global Templates >> Add new Global  Tempate
#* From any space > Space tools > Content Tools > Templates > Create New Template
#  Add a variable {{$test}} in the template by 
#* Typing {{$test}}
#* Go to "Insert template items into this page" > New Variable > type {{$test}}
# Add the existing variable again in the template by going to "Insert template items into this page" > choose {{$test}}

More information: watch the recording  [^CONFSERVER-33235.mp4] 

h3. Expected Result
Both of the variable should only have one dollar sign at the start of variable

h3.Observed Result
The second variable which are reused have 2 dollar sign at the start of the variable.

h3. Workaround
Type "$" to trigger Variable Suggestions and choose the variable from there instead from the macro menu
fields.summary: Double dollar sign '$' when inserting existing variable in a template

fields.description:
When you copy/paste from the left hand side navigation tree you get a <span class="plugin_pagetree_children_span"> in your content. 
This leads to a completely broken layout in the HTML view, but not in the editor and not in the PDF output. Since the editor is capable of parsing this, I assume the mangled view in the HTML view is a bug. 

This was no problem up to Confluence 4.3. Only after upgrading to Confluence 5 this newly occurred.

Thomas

fields.description:
If you write a plugin with a macro definition which is used (ie has been stored in a page somewhere) and then need to change the macro key you are left with little options.

Macro aliases allow you to provide multiple aliases for your macro but these are only used for auto completion and macro browsing.

Macro aliases should also be used when marshalling macros from storage to view and edit.

fields.description:
This affects JIRA 6.3-OD3 (probably some previous releases too, but I haven't verified this).

The BackOffScheduler class calls scheduler.shutdown() but this doesn't have effect as threads inside this scheduler are waiting on empty queue, so scheduler won't shutdown. Possible solution is to call shutdownNow() instead. This will work, but it probably will loose any events that are queued (if there are any). On the other hand, JIRA/plugin system is going down when this method is called, so we can't do much here... It might be worth to perform flush before shutdown. Anyway, scheduler need to be terminated.

As the scheduler is not properly shutdown, it still runs after destroy was called. Due to that the thread holds reference to class loader, and pico container cannot be fully freed - 20MB of memory is still hold.

Please also add name for that thread - it's easier to analyse memory dumps then. For example:

{code}newScheduledThreadPool(3, ThreadFactories.namedThreadFactory("MyworkPlugin-BackOffScheduler"));{code}

Also as this code is in common module, I guess that this problem will also affect confluence.

JIRA uses 1.8 version of mywork plugin, but problem still exists in master version. I don't know if JIRA can use latest version of mywork plugin.

BTW, does this code supports 4 and more application links? I'm afraid it won't work for 4+ application link (as all 3 threads will wait on queues). But I didn't analysed it further, so feel free to raise separate issue if that's true ;).
fields.summary: Mywork JIRA plugin doesn't shutdown threads properly on plugin system shutdown - this causes OOM on permgen during JIRA import
